channel.title: 2 Questions About Saving and Voids
channel.description:
Okay, so, whenever I try adding something to save for my Server, and I compile and everything, I log in and all that happened what that my player lost its look and went back to the original character look. So basically it's not saving and it results in an error. Can you think of any reasons of why this would be happening?
Second, I am trying to make a command to send a message to a certain player, and to do that I need to make a void. I know how to start the void and all, but I don't know what all this stuff does and how to use it: [code] outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34); // init item to smith screen outStream.writeWord(column); // Column Across Smith Screen outStream.writeByte(4); // Total Rows? outStream.writeDWord(slot); // Row Down The Smith Screen outStream.writeWord(id+1); // item outStream.writeByte(amount); // how many there are? outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); [/code] And stuff like that. So, I would like someone to explain all that if possible. This is really the only way to make this command work so... thanks. :)

item.title: 2 Questions About Saving and Voids
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Okay, so, whenever I try adding something to save for my Server, and I compile and everything, I log in and all that happened what that my player lost its look and went back to the original character look. So basically it’s not saving and it results in an error. Can you think of any reasons of why this would be happening?

Second, I am trying to make a command to send a message to a certain player, and to do that I need to make a void. I know how to start the void and all, but I don’t know what all this stuff does and how to use it:

outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34); // init item to smith screen outStream.writeWord(column); // Column Across Smith Screen outStream.writeByte(4); // Total Rows? outStream.writeDWord(slot); // Row Down The Smith Screen outStream.writeWord(id+1); // item outStream.writeByte(amount); // how many there are? outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); And stuff like that. So, I would like someone to explain all that if possible. This is really the only way to make this command work so… thanks.
